eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed Consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Signed informed consent must be obtained prior to participation in the study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patients ≥ 18 years of age at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Participant Cooperation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant cooperation sufficient for adequate fundus photographs and retinal images.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Diabetes Diagnosis and HbA1c
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patients diagnosed with type 1 or 2 DM, and HbA1c ≤ 12% at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Stable Diabetes Medication
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any medication administered for the management of DM should be stable within 3 months prior to randomization and is expected to remain stable during the course of the study, as medically acceptable.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: PDR Diagnosis Study Eye
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: PDR as assessed by the investigator using standard or wide-field CFP and FA, with no evidence of previous PRP, and that requires treatment with either anti-VEGF or PRP in the opinion of the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: BCVA Requirement Study Eye
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: BCVA ≥ 34 ETDRS letters (Snellen equivalent 20/200) at Screening and Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Concomitant Ocular Disorders
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Concomitant conditions or ocular disorders in the study eye at Screening or Baseline as well as planned medical/surgical intervention during the first 54-week study period that could compromise functional or structural response to study treatment, in the opinion of the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Center-involved DME
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Presence of center-involved diabetic macular edema in the study eye at Screening or Baseline, as assessed by the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active Infection or Inflammation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any active intraocular or periocular infection or active intraocular inflammation (e.g. infectious conjunctivitis, keratitis, scleritis, infectious blepharitis, uveitis) in the study eye at Screening or Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Uncontrolled Glaucoma
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled glaucoma in the study eye defined as IOP > 25 mmHg despite treatment with IOP-lowering medication, or according to investigator’s judgment, at Screening or Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreous Hemorrhage
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Moderate or dense pre-retinal or vitreous hemorrhage that prevents clear visualization of the macular and /or optic disc or prevents PRP treatment in the study eye at Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreoretinal Proliferation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Significant fibrovascular vitreoretinal proliferation or tractional retinal detachment of the study eye.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Neovascularization
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Iris or anterior chamber angle neovascularization, or neovascular glaucoma in the study eye.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Fellow Eye Condition
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Presence of amblyopia, amaurosis, or ocular disorders in the fellow eye with BCVA < 20/200 at Screening (except when due to conditions for which treatment or surgery may improve VA, e.g. cataract).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior PRP
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: PRP any time prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Anti-VEGF
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Intravitreal anti-VEGF treatment within 6 months prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreoretinal Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Vitreoretinal surgery at any time prior to Baseline or anticipated need for vitreoretinal surgery within the next 12 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Macular Laser
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Laser treatment of the macula within 3 months prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Corticosteroid Implants
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Treatment with fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant (e.g. ILUVIEN® or RETISERT®) at any time prior to Baseline. Other intraocular or periocular corticosteroid injection within 6 months prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Aphakia
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Aphakia with the absence of posterior capsule.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Intraocular Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Intraocular surgery within 3 months prior to Baseline or anticipated need for cataract extraction within the next 12 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Stroke or MI
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Stroke or myocardial infarction during the 6-month period prior to baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Renal Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: End stage renal disease requiring dialysis or renal transplant.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Uncontrolled Blood Pressure
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled blood pressure defined as a systolic value ≥ 180 mmHg or diastolic value ≥ 100 mmHg at screening or baseline. (In case there is an elevated blood pressure measurement, it should be repeated after approximately 20 minutes. If the repeat measurement is elevated, then the patient is not eligible to be enrolled into the study).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Systemic Anti-VEGF
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Systemic anti-VEGF therapy at any time.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Toxic Systemic Medications
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Systemic medications known to be toxic to the lens, retina or optic nerve (e.g., deferoxamine, chloroquine/hydroxychloroquine, tamoxifen, phenothiazines and ethambutol) used during the 6‑month period prior to Baseline except temporary use for Coronavirus 19 (COVID-19) treatment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hypersensitivity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of hypersensitivity to any of the study drugs or their excipients or to drugs of similar classes, or clinically relevant sensitivity to fluorescein dye as assessed by the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: History of Malignancy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of malignancy of any organ system (other than localized basal cell carcinoma of the skin or in situ cervical cancer), treated or untreated, within the past 5 years prior to Screening, regardless of whether there is evidence of local recurrence or metastases.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: General Medical Condition
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of a medical condition (e.g. metabolic dysfunction disease with exception of type 1 or 2 DM, or clinical laboratory finding) that, in the judgment of the investigator, would preclude scheduled study visits, completion of the study, or a safe administration of investigational product.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Investigational Drugs
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Use of systemic investigational drugs within 5 half-lives of baseline, or within 30 days / until the expected pharmacodynamic effect has returned to baseline, whichever is longer; or longer if required by local regulations (observational clinical studies solely involving over-the-counter vitamins, supplements, or diets are not exclusionary).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy and Nursing
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women, where pregnancy is defined as the state of a female after conception and until the termination of gestation, confirmed by a positive human chorionic gonadotropin pregnancy test.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception Requirements
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Women of child-bearing potential, defined as all women physiologically capable of becoming pregnant, unless they are using highly effective methods of contraception during the study drug administration and for at least one month after stopping the investigational medication.
